title: Christchurch Lotto player wins big
text:
Christchurch Lotto player wins big Last updated 21:35, February 22 2017 GEORGE HEARD/FAIRFAX NZ 
Wednesday's $1 million winning ticket was sold at a supermarket in Wainoni, Christchurch. 
One lucky Lotto player has had an above average hump day, winning $1 million with First Division in Wednesday's draw. 
The winning ticket was sold at Wainoni Pak N Save in Christchurch, Lotto NZ spokeswoman Kirsten Robinson said. 
Powerball rolled over to Saturday night, where the jackpot will be $7 million. 
Strike Four was also won tonight, with players from Hawera and Gore each taking home $350,000. The winning tickets were sold at Countdown Hawera in Hawera and United Video Gore in Gore. 
Anyone who bought their ticket from the above stores should write their name on the back of the ticket and check it immediately at any Lotto outlet, online at MyLotto.co.nz , or through the Lotto NZ ticket-checker app, Robinson said.
